column4: Hmpfh.  Why is 'unrar' nonfree?  Is 'rar' patented?  If not, why isn't there any free implementations yet? :)
licencing or patenting?
I probably should.  it would be cool to implement a free verson :)
Seems that the source code for RAR is distributed, but under a licence which forbids reverse engineering.
Wonder how much work it would be for a decent hacker to reverse engineneer from binary, and for someone else to implement it.
Personally I prefer KDE .. it's just so nice, has all the features I've enjoyed in other WM's, and so forth
.. hmm.. possibly except one.  Afterstep had a wonderfull feature .. that you could scroll from one desktop to the next.
.. and stop inbetween.
that one I miss.  Except for that one, KDE fills all my needs. :)
I believe FVWM also has a virtual desktop
Yeah, it does.  Problem is, I don't _like_ FVWM. :-/
While I _love_ KDE. :-)
OK
dpkg-reconfigure mdadm ?
Well, no.
The kernel I _can_ boot with doesn't have drivers that recognize the sata-controllers.
sorry then
The kernel I _cannot_ boot with recognized the sata-controllers .. ubuntu tries to use the drive, and the box hangs.
It's probably a configuration file I just need to remove a line from.
Or a rcX.d script I need to remove from a runlevel.
But I'm fscked if it just checks the disk for an md-partition and goes bust if the partition is bust.
